Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2018 10:58PM Annieplaysguitar wrote: Hi there, I'm wondering if I can ask a question about that post.  I'm from BC, Canada and was lucky to have had my sample sent to California for the Oncotype test as we don't yet have that here in Canada.  I had a left lumpectomy in Sept 2018, 25 mm tumor and 2 positive nodes.  One node was barely tracible - they were both well encapsulated.  My Oncotype score came back today at 14, but my Oncologist is saying that I should have Chemo still.  I'm 52.  I don't think I have the information you ladies may have, as I see you are talking about graphs etc....  Could you share that information with me.  I want to do the right thing for my body - all the information I am finding is on the breast only and not for node positive - and the grey area I keep reading about is where I am at 14.  They are saying the grey area is from 11-18.  Can anyone share helpful information with me.  I would love some help.  Thank you so much
Posts.Title: Do you afraid from recurrence?!!!!!!! Danaqtr sheyma
